description: Comprehensive knowledge base for content scheduling features, including posting strategies, batch content creation, calendar planning, and scheduling workflows.

qa_pairs.question: How do I schedule a post?
qa_pairs.answer:
**Schedule a Post in 3 Steps:**

**Step 1: Create Your Post**

1. Go to your **Creator Dashboard**
2. Click **Create Post** or **Upload Content**
3. Add your content (photos, videos, text)
4. Set subscription tier access

**Step 2: Set Schedule**

1. Instead of "Post Now," click **Schedule Post** or the calendar icon
2. Select **Date** using the calendar picker
3. Select **Time** (12-hour or 24-hour format)
4. Confirm your timezone is correct (e.g., "PST - Pacific Standard Time")
5. Click **Schedule**

**Step 3: Confirmation**

You'll see: "‚úì Post scheduled for [Date] at [Time]"

The post appears in **Dashboard ‚Üí Scheduled Posts** and will automatically publish at the scheduled time.

**Other Ways to Schedule:**

- **From Drafts**: Dashboard ‚Üí Drafts ‚Üí Select draft ‚Üí Schedule
- **Bulk Scheduling**: Select multiple posts ‚Üí Bulk Actions ‚Üí Schedule
- **Reschedule Published**: Edit any scheduled post anytime before it goes live

**Important:**
- You can edit or cancel scheduled posts anytime up to 1 minute before publication
- You'll receive a notification when your post goes live
- Posts use the timezone you set when scheduling (double-check when traveling!)

**Time Limits:**
- Schedule as far as **90 days** in advance
- Minimum **5 minutes** ahead

**Pro Tip:** Use Calendar View (Dashboard ‚Üí Scheduled Posts ‚Üí Calendar) to visualize your entire content schedule at a glance.
question_variations: can I schedule posts ahead of time
schedule a post for specific time
can I schedule posts for future dates

qa_pairs.question: When is the best time to schedule posts?
qa_pairs.answer:
**Best Posting Times Based on Platform Data:**

**Weekdays:**
- **Early morning (6-8 AM)**: Subscribers checking during commute
- **Lunch hour (12-1 PM)**: Midday browsing
- **Evening (6-9 PM)**: ‚≠ê **PEAK ENGAGEMENT TIME**
- **Late night (10 PM-12 AM)**: Before bed scrolling

**Weekends:**
- **Late morning (10 AM-12 PM)**: Relaxed weekend browsing
- **Afternoon (2-4 PM)**: Downtime engagement
- **Evening (7-10 PM)**: Weekend entertainment time

**But YOUR audience might be different!**

**Find Your Optimal Times:**

1. Go to **Analytics ‚Üí Engagement**
2. View **Subscriber Activity Heatmap**
3. Note when your subscribers are most active
4. Schedule posts **30 minutes before peak times**

**Why 30 minutes before?** Posts need time to appear in feeds and start getting initial engagement, which boosts visibility.

**Content Type Matters:**

| Content Type | Best Time | Why |
|-------------|-----------|-----|
| **Casual photos** | Morning (7-9 AM) | Light browsing time |
| **Premium videos** | Evening (7-10 PM) | More engagement time |
| **Polls/Q&As** | Afternoon (3-5 PM) | More interaction time |
| **Personal stories** | Late night (9-11 PM) | Intimate, relaxed time |
| **Teaser content** | Midday (12-2 PM) | Builds anticipation |

**Weekly Pattern Example:**

- **Monday**: 7 AM (motivational start to week)
- **Wednesday**: 8 PM (midweek engagement peak)
- **Friday**: 9 PM (weekend excitement)
- **Sunday**: 8 PM (preparing for week ahead)

**Pro Tips:**

- **Test different times** for 2-3 weeks and compare performance
- **Avoid oversaturated times** (if everyone posts at 6 PM, try 6:30 or 7:15)
- **Consider time zones**: If you have international subscribers, rotate posting times
- **Holiday schedules shift**: People browse more during day when off work

**Quick Start:** If you don't have analytics yet, start with **7-9 PM weekdays** and **10 AM-12 PM weekends** ‚Äì these work well for most creators.
question_variations: what time do subscribers engage most
when should I post for maximum engagement
what time gets the most views

qa_pairs.question: How do I manage my scheduled posts?
qa_pairs.answer:
**Managing Your Scheduled Content:**

**View Scheduled Posts:**

**Desktop:**
1. Go to **Dashboard ‚Üí Scheduled Posts**
2. Choose view:
   - **List View**: All posts in chronological order
   - **Calendar View**: Visual calendar with post thumbnails
3. See details: thumbnail, caption preview, date, time, tier

**Mobile App:**
1. Tap **Menu ‚Üí Scheduled**
2. Swipe through upcoming posts
3. Tap any post for full details

---

**Edit Scheduled Posts:**

1. Click on any scheduled post
2. Click **Edit**
3. Make changes:
   - Update photos, videos, or text
   - Modify caption or description
   - Change subscription tier
   - Adjust price (for PPV content)
   - **Change date/time**
4. Click **Save Changes**

**Edit anytime up to 1 minute before scheduled time.**

---

**Reschedule Posts:**

**Quick Method:**
1. Click scheduled post
2. Click **Reschedule**
3. Pick new date/time
4. Click **Update**

**Drag-and-Drop** (Calendar View):
1. Switch to Calendar View
2. Drag post thumbnail to new date/time slot
3. Confirm new schedule

---

**Cancel Scheduled Posts:**

**Single Post:**
1. Click the post
2. Click **Cancel Schedule**
3. Confirm cancellation
4. Post moves to **Drafts** (not deleted ‚Äì you can reschedule later)

**Multiple Posts:**
1. Select multiple posts (checkboxes)
2. Click **Bulk Actions ‚Üí Cancel Schedule**
3. Confirm
4. All selected posts move to Drafts

---

**Bulk Management:**

Select multiple scheduled posts to:
- **Reschedule all**: Spread posts over different date range
- **Change tier**: Move all from "All Subscribers" to "VIP Only"
- **Cancel all**: Move back to drafts
- **Delete**: Permanently remove

**Example Use Case:**
- You scheduled 30 posts for next 7 days (too many!)
- Select 15 posts ‚Üí Bulk Actions ‚Üí Reschedule
- Spread over 30 days instead (1 per day)

---

**Notifications:**

Get notified when:
- ‚úì Post successfully publishes: "Your post is now live!"
- ‚ö† Scheduling fails: "Post failed to publish - action required"
- üìä Post receives engagement shortly after going live

**Configure Notifications:**
1. **Settings ‚Üí Notifications ‚Üí Scheduled Content**
2. Toggle:
   - ‚òë Notify when post goes live
   - ‚òë Notify if scheduling fails
   - ‚òë Daily summary of scheduled posts
   - ‚òë Reminder 1 hour before post goes live

---

**Search & Filter:**

Find specific scheduled posts:
- **Search bar**: Search by caption text or internal title
- **Filter by tier**: Show only VIP posts, PPV posts, etc.
- **Filter by date range**: Next 7 days, this month, etc.
- **Filter by content type**: Photos only, videos only, polls, etc.

---

**Quick Tips:**

- **Use internal titles** for easy searching (e.g., "Week 3 Monday - Blue outfit - VIP promo")
- **Color-code tiers** in Calendar View for quick visual reference
- **Export schedule** as CSV to review in Excel/Sheets
- **Set reminders** to review schedule weekly and adjust as needed

qa_pairs.question: What's the best content scheduling strategy?
qa_pairs.answer:
**Effective Content Scheduling Strategies:**

**1. Batch Content Creation**

The most efficient approach for consistent posting:

**Weekly Batch Example:**
- **Sunday evening**: Plan 7 posts for the week
- **Monday**: Shoot all content in 2-hour session (photos/videos)
- **Tuesday**: Edit content and write captions
- **Wednesday**: Upload and schedule all 7 posts
- **Rest of week**: Focus on engagement, DMs, comments

**Monthly Batch Example:**
- **One weekend day/month** (4-6 hours):
  - Professional photo shoot with multiple setups
  - Record several short videos
  - Create 12-16 posts worth of content
- Schedule everything for the month
- Add spontaneous posts throughout

**Benefits:**
- Consistent quality (same lighting, equipment, mindset)
- Less daily stress and decision fatigue
- More free time during week/month
- Cohesive content themes

---

**2. Recommended Posting Frequency**

| Subscriber Count | Posts/Week | Posts/Day |
|-----------------|------------|----------|
| 0-100 | 5-7 | 1/day |
| 100-500 | 7-10 | 1-2/day |
| 500-1000 | 10-14 | 2/day |
| 1000-5000 | 14-21 | 2-3/day |
| 5000+ | 21-35 | 3-5/day |

**Why not more?**
- Subscriber feed fatigue
- Lower engagement per post
- Quality over quantity wins

---

**3. Content Calendar Template**

**Weekly Schedule:**

| Day | Time | Content Type | Tier |
|-----|------|--------------|------|
| **Mon** | 7 AM | Motivational + photo | All |
| **Tue** | 6 PM | Behind-the-scenes video | VIP |
| **Wed** | 8 PM | Q&A or poll | All |
| **Thu** | 7 AM | Teaser for weekend | All |
| **Fri** | 9 PM | Premium photo set | VIP |
| **Sat** | 11 AM | Personal story/update | All |
| **Sun** | 8 PM | Exclusive video | Premium |

**Monthly Themes:**
- **Week 1**: Relationship-building (Q&As, personal stories)
- **Week 2**: High-value content (photo sets, videos)
- **Week 3**: Engagement (polls, challenges, games)
- **Week 4**: Premium exclusives (custom requests, special content)

---

**4. The 70/30 Rule**

**Don't schedule 100% of your content!**

- **70% scheduled**: Core content, planned posts, consistent schedule
- **30% spontaneous**: Real-time updates, trend responses, surprise posts

**Why?**
- Keeps page feeling alive and authentic
- Allows flexibility for current events/trends
- Shows subscribers you're actively present
- Creates excitement ("She just posted!")

---

**5. Vacation/Travel Strategy**

Going away? Front-load your schedule:

**1 Week Vacation:**
- Pre-schedule 7-10 posts (1-1.5/day)
- Use generic captions (avoid "Good morning!" or time-specific text)
- Schedule engagement posts (polls, questions)
- Set up auto-responder for DMs

**2+ Weeks Away:**
- Schedule 2-3 weeks of content
- Include announcement: "I'll be traveling but new content drops daily!"
- Reduce posting frequency slightly (subscribers understand)
- Have trusted assistant monitor for issues

---

**6. Seasonal Planning**

**Schedule Holiday Content Early:**

Plan 1-2 weeks ahead for:
- Valentine's Day (Feb 14)
- Halloween (Oct 31)
- Thanksgiving (Nov)
- Christmas (Dec 25)
- New Year's (Dec 31)
- Your birthday
- Platform anniversary

**Why early?** Enjoy the actual holiday stress-free while pre-scheduled content posts automatically.

---

**7. Test and Optimize**

**A/B Test Posting Times:**
- **Week 1**: Post daily at 6 PM
- **Week 2**: Post daily at 8 PM
- **Week 3**: Post daily at 9 AM
- **Week 4**: Review Analytics to see which time performed best

**Track Metrics:**
- Views per post
- Likes and comments
- New subscriptions within 24 hours
- Revenue generated

**Analytics ‚Üí Engagement** shows performance by posting time.

---

**8. Common Workflows**

**Workflow A: Daily Consistent**
- Goal: 1 post/day
- Time: 5-6 hours/week front-loaded
- Method: Batch create weekly, schedule all at once

**Workflow B: Premium Quality**
- Goal: 2-3 premium posts/week
- Time: 1 full day/week
- Method: High-production content + daily casual posts

**Workflow C: Hybrid**
- Goal: Consistent base + spontaneous extras
- Method: Schedule base content 2 weeks ahead, add real-time posts in between

---

**Quick Start Strategy:**

**Week 1:**
1. Create 7 posts
2. Schedule 1/day at 7 PM (proven good time)
3. Monitor engagement

**Week 2:**
4. Analyze which posts performed best
5. Create more of that content type
6. Adjust timing based on analytics

**Week 3+:**
7. Scale to 2 weeks scheduled in advance
8. Add spontaneous posts
9. Refine based on data

**Remember:** Consistency beats perfection. A regular schedule with good content outperforms sporadic posting of "perfect" content.

qa_pairs.question: My scheduled post didn't publish. What happened?
qa_pairs.answer:
**Troubleshooting Failed Scheduled Posts:**

**Common Causes & Solutions:**

---

**1. Payment Processing Issue** (for PPV content)

**Problem:** Your payment settings aren't configured properly

**Solution:**
1. Go to **Settings ‚Üí Payments**
2. Verify:
   - Bank account connected and verified
   - Payment processor active
   - No pending verification requirements
3. Fix any issues
4. Go to **Scheduled Posts** ‚Üí Find the post (it has ‚ö† icon)
5. Click **Retry Publishing** or reschedule

---

**2. File Size Too Large**

**Problem:** Video exceeded size limit after processing

**Limits:**
- Photos: 50 MB per file
- Videos: 5 GB per file, 60 minutes max length
- Total upload: 10 GB per post

**Solution:**
1. Download the original video from Scheduled Posts
2. Re-compress using:
   - **HandBrake** (free, desktop)
   - **Video Compressor** apps
   - Online tools like Clideo
3. Target: 1080p, H.264 codec, 5-15 Mbps bitrate
4. Re-upload and reschedule

---

**3. Account Restriction**

**Problem:** Verification pending or policy violation under review

**Solution:**
1. Check your email for notifications
2. Go to **Settings ‚Üí Account Status**
3. Resolve any pending issues:
   - Complete ID verification
   - Respond to policy review
   - Verify payment information
4. Once resolved, scheduled posts will auto-retry or you can manually publish

---

**4. Content Policy Violation**

**Problem:** Automated system flagged content during pre-publish scan

**Possible flags:**
- Prohibited content detected
- Copyrighted material (music, logos)
- Terms of service violation

**Solution:**
1. Check notification for specific reason
2. Edit post to remove flagged content:
   - Replace copyrighted music
   - Remove prohibited items
   - Adjust caption if needed
3. Request manual review if you believe it's a mistake
4. Reschedule once approved

---

**5. Timezone Confusion**

**Problem:** Post scheduled in wrong timezone, so time passed or hasn't come yet

**Example:**
- You're in PST but account set to EST
- Scheduled for "6 PM" but it used EST time
- Post published at 3 PM PST (6 PM EST) instead of intended 6 PM PST

**Solution:**
1. **Settings ‚Üí Account ‚Üí Timezone**
2. Set correct timezone
3. Review all scheduled posts for correct times
4. Reschedule any affected posts

**Pro tip:** Enable "Auto-detect timezone" if you travel frequently

---

**6. Internet Connection Lost During Upload**

**Problem:** Upload didn't complete before losing connection

**Solution:**
1. Go to **Dashboard ‚Üí Drafts**
2. Find incomplete upload (shows partial progress)
3. Click **Resume Upload** or delete and re-upload
4. Wait for "Upload Complete" confirmation
5. Then schedule

**Prevention:** Don't close browser until you see "‚úì Upload complete"

---

**What Happens When Scheduling Fails:**

1. **Post stays in queue** with ‚ö† error icon
2. **You receive notification**: "Post failed to publish - action required"
3. **Specific error shown** when you click the post
4. **Post does NOT auto-delete** ‚Äì you can fix and retry

---

**Checking for Failed Posts:**

**Desktop:**
1. Go to **Dashboard ‚Üí Scheduled Posts**
2. Look for ‚ö† icon next to any post
3. Click to see error details

**Mobile:**
1. Tap **Menu ‚Üí Scheduled**
2. Posts with issues show red badge
3. Tap for details and fix options

---

**Preventing Future Issues:**

‚úì **Always preview** posts before scheduling
‚úì **Test video playback** before uploading
‚úì **Verify payment settings** are active
‚úì **Check account status** regularly
‚úì **Use stable internet** for uploads
‚úì **Don't close browser** until upload completes
‚úì **Double-check timezone** especially when traveling
‚úì **Stay within file size limits** (compress large videos)
‚úì **Review scheduled posts weekly** to catch issues early

---

**Still Having Issues?**

**Contact Support:**
1. Go to **Settings ‚Üí Help & Support**
2. Click **Contact Support**
3. Choose "Scheduled Posts Issue"
4. Include:
   - Post ID (shown in error message)
   - Screenshot of error
   - When you scheduled it
   - What content type (photo/video)
5. Support typically responds within 24 hours

**Emergency Publishing:**
If you need the post live immediately:
1. Cancel the schedule
2. Post goes to Drafts
3. Click **Publish Now** (bypasses scheduling)
4. Manually post at intended time
question_variations: why didn't my scheduled post go live
post didn't appear at scheduled time

qa_pairs.question: Can I schedule recurring posts?
qa_pairs.answer:
**Yes! Set Up Recurring Scheduled Posts:**

**How to Create Recurring Posts:**

1. Create your post (upload content, write caption)
2. Click **Schedule**
3. Set initial date and time
4. Toggle **Repeat** option (look for repeat icon üîÑ)
5. Choose frequency:
   - **Daily**
   - **Weekly** (select specific days: Mon/Wed/Fri)
   - **Bi-weekly** (every 2 weeks)
   - **Monthly** (e.g., "First Monday of each month" or "15th of each month")
6. Set end condition:
   - **End date**: Stop repeating after specific date
   - **After X occurrences**: Stop after 10 posts, 20 posts, etc.
   - **Repeat indefinitely**: Continues until you manually stop it
7. Click **Create Recurring Schedule**

---

**Use Cases for Recurring Posts:**

**1. Weekly Check-Ins**
- **Every Monday at 8 AM**: "Monday Motivation" post
- **Every Friday at 9 PM**: "Weekend Plans" update
- **Every Sunday at 7 PM**: "Week in Review" summary

**2. Monthly Events**
- **First Friday each month**: Live Q&A announcement
- **15th of each month**: Subscriber appreciation post
- **Last day of month**: Next month's preview/teaser

**3. Daily Routines**
- **Every morning at 7 AM**: "Good morning" greeting with motivational quote
- **Every evening at 10 PM**: "Good night" post with behind-the-scenes photo
- **Every afternoon at 3 PM**: Poll or question for engagement

**4. Content Series**
- **Every Tuesday/Thursday**: "Fitness Journey" updates
- **Every Wednesday**: "Throwback Wednesday" older photo reshare
- **Every weekend**: "Weekend Exclusive" premium content

---

**Example Setup: Weekly Monday Motivation**

**Content:** Inspirational quote + workout photo

**Schedule:**
- Day: Every Monday
- Time: 7:00 AM
- Tier: All Subscribers
- Repeat: Weekly (Mondays)
- End: After 12 occurrences (3 months)

**Result:** Post automatically publishes every Monday at 7 AM for next 3 months

---

**Managing Recurring Posts:**

**View All Occurrences:**
1. Go to **Dashboard ‚Üí Scheduled Posts ‚Üí Recurring**
2. See all recurring schedules
3. Click any to view upcoming dates

**Edit Recurring Schedule:**

You can edit:
- **Single occurrence**: Change just one upcoming post
- **All future occurrences**: Update the series from a specific date forward
- **Entire series**: Modify the whole recurring schedule

**To edit:**
1. Click recurring post in Scheduled Posts
2. Choose edit scope:
   - "This occurrence only"
   - "This and all future occurrences"
3. Make changes
4. Save

**Cancel Recurring Schedule:**

**Option 1: Stop All Future Posts**
1. Click recurring schedule
2. Click **Stop Recurrence**
3. Confirm
4. Already-scheduled posts remain, but no new ones created

**Option 2: Delete Entire Series**
1. Click recurring schedule
2. Click **Delete Series**
3. Confirm
4. Removes ALL future scheduled posts in the series

---

**Advanced Recurring Options:**

**Custom Intervals:**
- Every 3 days
- Every other week
- Every 2 months
- First and third Monday of each month

**Multiple Days Weekly:**
- Monday, Wednesday, Friday at 7 PM
- Tuesday and Thursday at 6 AM
- Every weekday (Mon-Fri) at noon
- Weekends only (Sat-Sun) at 10 AM

**Skip Dates:**
- Set recurring schedule
- Manually skip specific dates (holidays, vacations)
- Click specific occurrence ‚Üí "Skip this date"
- Recurrence continues after skipped date

---

**Important Notes:**

‚ö† **Content is identical** for each recurring post ‚Äì if you upload a specific photo, that same photo posts each time

**Workaround for varied content:**
1. Set up recurring **reminder** posts (text-only)
2. Each occurrence reminds you to add that week's specific content
3. Or create series of drafts, then bulk schedule at intervals

‚ö† **Timezone locks in** when you create recurrence ‚Äì doesn't auto-adjust if you travel

‚ö† **Maximum 100 occurrences** per recurring schedule (platform limit)

‚ö† **Subscription tier must stay consistent** ‚Äì can't alternate between "All" and "VIP" automatically

---

**Best Practices:**

‚úì **Use for consistent branding** (weekly themes, daily greetings)
‚úì **Set end dates** to review and refresh after 3-6 months
‚úì **Test with short series first** (4-5 occurrences) before committing to long-term
‚úì **Combine with unique posts** ‚Äì recurring should be 20-30% of content, not 100%
‚úì **Review performance** ‚Äì if recurring posts underperform, adjust or cancel
‚úì **Announce patterns to subscribers**: "Look for my Monday Motivation post every week!"
‚úì **Vary content slightly** even in recurring posts (different quotes, photos) by editing individual occurrences

---

**Alternatives to Recurring Schedules:**

**If recurring isn't quite right:**

1. **Content Series**: Upload multiple posts, schedule sequentially (daily, every other day, weekly)
2. **Bulk Scheduling**: Create 10 similar posts, schedule at regular intervals manually
3. **Templates**: Save post templates, manually create new post from template weekly
4. **Calendar Reminders**: Set external reminder to create and post specific content weekly

---

**Recurring vs. Series:**

| Feature | Recurring | Series |
|---------|-----------|--------|
| **Same content repeating** | ‚úì Yes | ‚úó No |
| **Different content each time** | ‚úó No | ‚úì Yes |
| **Automatic posting** | ‚úì Yes | ‚úì Yes |
| **Edit individual posts** | ‚úì Yes | ‚úì Yes |
| **Best for** | Consistent weekly themes | Multi-part stories |

---

**Quick Setup Example:**

**Goal:** Post "Good morning!" every weekday at 7 AM for next month

**Steps:**
1. Create text post: "Good morning! ‚òÄÔ∏è Hope you have an amazing day!"
2. Click **Schedule**
3. Set: Tomorrow at 7:00 AM
4. Enable **Repeat**
5. Choose: **Weekly** ‚Üí Select Mon, Tue, Wed, Thu, Fri
6. End: After 20 occurrences (4 weeks √ó 5 days)
7. Click **Create Recurring Schedule**
8. Done! 20 good morning posts automatically scheduled.

**Time saved:** Instead of creating 20 separate posts, you set it up once in 2 minutes.
question_variations: can I schedule the same post multiple times

2. Click **Schedule** instead of "Post Now"
3. Pick date and time
4. Done! Post auto-publishes.

- Schedule them to publish automatically
- Maintain consistent presence

- Less daily stress

- Weekends: 10 AM-12 PM

- [Current average posting time]

Dashboard ‚Üí Scheduled Posts ‚Üí **Calendar View** (top right)

‚úàÔ∏è **Planning a Vacation? Schedule Ahead!**

2. Find the post with ‚ö†Ô∏è icon
3. Fix the issue (see details below)
4. Reschedule or publish now

- Compress large videos
- Verify payment settings

[View Failed Post] [Contact Support] [Dismiss]

glossary.definition: Creating posts in advance and setting them to automatically publish at specific future dates and times.
Creating multiple pieces of content in a single session, then scheduling them to publish over an extended period.
Visual representation of scheduled posts displayed on a calendar, allowing drag-and-drop rescheduling.
Posts that automatically repeat at regular intervals (daily, weekly, monthly) without manual recreation.
The hours when subscribers are most active and likely to view, like, and comment on posts.
Scheduling multiple posts simultaneously, either spread evenly across a date range or at custom intervals.
Private label for scheduled posts visible only to the creator, used for organization (e.g., 'Week 3 Monday - Blue Outfit - VIP').
AI-powered feature that analyzes subscriber activity and suggests optimal posting times for maximum engagement.
Multiple related posts scheduled sequentially, often numbered or themed (e.g., '30 Days of Summer' or 'Behind the Scenes Week').
Analytics visualization showing when subscribers are most active, helping identify best posting times.
The list of all scheduled posts waiting to be automatically published, viewable in Dashboard ‚Üí Scheduled Posts.
When a scheduled post cannot be published at its designated time due to errors (file size, payment issues, etc.).
Posts publish based on the timezone set when scheduled, not the creator's current location.
Content strategy recommending 70% scheduled posts for consistency and 30% spontaneous posts for authenticity.
Pre-scheduling content to maintain posting consistency while taking time off from active content creation.

integration_points.connection: Subscriber Activity Heatmap shows optimal posting times for scheduling content when engagement peaks.
All uploaded content can be saved as drafts and scheduled for future publication instead of posting immediately.
Scheduled posts can be assigned to specific tiers (All, VIP, Premium) or set as pay-per-view with pricing.
Creators can configure notifications for when scheduled posts publish, fail, or receive engagement.
Scheduled posts can be created, edited, and managed from mobile app with full scheduling functionality.
Account restrictions from pending verification can prevent scheduled posts from publishing until resolved.
Scheduled content goes through pre-publish automated scanning; flagged content prevents publication until reviewed.
Scheduled posts automatically start collecting likes, comments, and engagement the moment they go live.

support_resources.title: Video Tutorial: Schedule Your First Post
